docs.lead_paragraph: MOST of the ablest college graduates whose first job is teaching leave the profession within five years. For them, teaching is merely a stepping stone to other fields. The graduates most likely to remain teachers are those with the fewest career options and those who prefer job security and working hours most compatible with family life and their children's schedules. The long-range effect of this trend will be a continuing downward slide in the quality of teaching in the nation's schools, unless steps are taken to make teaching more competitive with other ''human services'' occupations.
